author: Euan McKirdy, CNN
description: Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte is soon to depart on an official visit Moscow as part of the Asian nation's pivot away from the United States
title: Philippines' Duterte looks to strengthen ties with trip to Moscow

author: The Associated Press
description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte declared the country's south under martial rule for 60 days.
title: Duterte declares martial rule in south Philippines amid deadly clashes

author: Nyshka Chandran
description: Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte's hint of nationwide martial law has triggered fears of further human rights violations.
title: Philippines: Duterte's talk of martial law sparks fresh human rights worries

author: JIM GOMEZ and TERESA CEROJANO
description: MANILA, Philippines (AP) — Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte warned Wednesday that he'll be harsh in enforcing martial law in his country's south as he abruptly left Moscow to deal with a crisis at home sparked by a Muslim extremist siege on a city, where militants burned buildings overnight and are feared to have taken hostages. Duterte declared martial rule for 60 days in the entire southern Mindanao region, the restive third of the Philippine archipelago, Tuesday evening to try to crush Muslim extremists who have aligned themselves with the Islamic State group and occupied a hospital, jail and other buildings and battled troops in an audacious attack in Marawi City.
title: Duterte declares martial rule in besieged south Philippines

author: JIM GOMEZ and TERESA CEROJANO
description: MARAWI, Philippines (AP) — Army tanks packed with soldiers rolled into a southern Philippine city Thursday as gunfire and explosions rang out after militants linked to the Islamic State group torched buildings, seized more than a dozen Catholic hostages and raised the black flag of ISIS. At least 21 people have died in fighting that erupted late Tuesday, when the army raided the Marawi hideout of Isnilon Hapilon, who is on Washington's list of most-wanted terrorists and has a $5 million bounty on his head.
title: Islamic State-linked militants besiege Philippine city

author: JIM GOMEZ and TERESA CEROJANO
description: MARAWI, Philippines (AP) — Army tanks packed with soldiers have rolled into a southern Philippine city to try to restore control after militants linked to Islamic State group launched a violent siege. Thousands of civilians have been fleeing the city of some 200,000 people. At least 21 people have died in fighting that erupted late Tuesday, when the army raided the Marawi hideout of Isnilon Hapilon. Hapilon is on Washington's list of most-wanted terrorists and has a $5 million bounty on his head.
title: Soldiers try to restore order in besieged Philippine city

author: Reuters
description: Duterte said Xi had warned him there would be war if the Philippines tried to explore for oil in the South China Sea.
title: The Philippines is starting up damage control after Duterte claims China threatened war

description: Islamic State group-linked militants swept through a southern Philippine city, beheading a police chief, burning buildings, seizing a Catholic priest and his worshippers and raising the black flag of IS, authorities said Wednesday.
title: ISIS-linked militants attack Philippine city, behead police chief

author: Romeo Ranoco
description: Thousands of civilians fled fighting in the Philippines on Wednesday as troops tried to fend off Islamist militants who took over large parts of a city, capturing Christians, seizing and torching buildings and setting free scores of prisoners.
title: Thousands flee Philippine city after rebel rampage claimed by Islamic State

author: Romeo Ranoco
description: Troops backed by attack helicopters battled dozens of militants linked to the Islamic State group holed up in a besieged city in the southern Philippines on Thursday after attempts to secure volatile areas met heavy resistance.
title: Philippines deploys helicopters in battle to retake city from Islamist rebels
